intro: Allioniella, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are herbaceous perennials native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets and produce small, yellowish flowers. Allioniella species are often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky soils. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
